title: Beam Background Simulation and Experiment at BEPCII. (arXiv:2210.11871v2 [physics.acc-ph] UPDATED)
description: A high-level beam background is a crucial challenge to future upgrades to the BEPCII collider. We report here on the components of the background of a single beam at the BEPCII collider and the BESIII detector in an experiment. Touschek effect is the dominant source of the beam background in the inner detector, where this is different from the previous understanding of beam background at BEPCII. We also report a simulation of the beam background, and compare the background count rates obtained by it with those measured in the experiment.
